segments.text: I see the woman lost in her task, polishing that plate as if it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is overflowing from the sink like a waterfall, and I can’t believe she doesn’t notice it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think how careless it is to leave the water running like that, especially with children around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, and yet she just keeps drying dishes, oblivious to the chaos behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the boy is teetering on that stool, stretching his little arm toward the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but worry; any moment now, he could tumble backward and hurt himself.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But then I see the girl with her hand raised, so hopeful for a cookie, and it’s almost sweet to watch.
segments.speaker: PAR
